p: Gastric damage is a well-known collateral adverse effect in NSAIDs because of the pharmacological mechanism of action. Indistinct inhibition of cyclooxygenase 1 (COX-1) and 2 (COX-2) by this anti-inflammatory drug is the cause of ulcers in the muscular layer of the stomach [ 37]. Our data agree with a preventive gastric damage instead of ulceration preliminary reported for the T. patula essential oil [ 38]. These results reinforce the medicinal use of Tagetes species and bioactive constituents of their essential oils for gastrointestinal diseases.
